value.title: Open your Power BI Desktop model in Excel with just one click (two methods)
value.excerpt: It is now possible to download your Power BI desktop data into Excel with a simple click and I am going to show you two methods in this video. Enjoy! value.title: Power BI vs Excel: When you should use each tool
value.excerpt: Which tool is best? Power BI or Excel?  Well, it depends on what you are trying to do. Both tools have unique strengths and limitations and in this video I will try to show both.  Hopefully after watching this video, you will have a better understanding of both tools and will know when to use which depending

value.title: Pushing the Power BI buttons 👆
value.excerpt: You haven't missed the Power Bi April 2018 update right?  My favourite feature is by far the new buttons! With Power Bi buttons you can create all kinds of experiences, like buttons to change charts, as I show in this demo.  What is your favourite Power BI april 2018 update? Let me know in the comment

value.title: Reuse M code (M functions) created by others easily
value.excerpt: In today's video I am collaborating with Imke Feldmann to bring you the best that M or Power Query has to offer.  We will show you how you can easily re-use M functions in your reports. value.title: Store data from PowerApps in sql, approve it in flow and use it in Power bI

After the stopword is sent to sql, a flow will be started to approve the new word. The data will then be imported in Power BI where the

value.title: Working hours without Holidays, weekends and by country in power query
value.excerpt: In today's video we are going to write a function that calculates work hour (seconds) between two datetimes. Working hour by location, holidays will also be included :)  Link to Bills thread: https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/f3fc729e-a2ec-409a-b20e-b5cf8ff5dc2a/calculate-work-hours-between-two-timedate-stamps?forum=powerquery

value.title: Convert data from HTML to Plain Text using Power Query for Power BI Table Visualization
value.excerpt: As we all know, Power BI table visualization does not support HTML generation. So, we need to convert our HTML text to Plain text.   With the help of Power Query function, we can easily remove HTML tags from the Text in Power Query. To implement that we need to use function HTML.table() in Power Query.

value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access.
